meanings.definition: Scrimshaws (verb): to carve or engrave designs on whalebone or ivory
meanings.sent1: Grandpa scrimshaws a beautiful whalebone pendant for me.
meanings.sent2: The artist scrimshaws intricate patterns on the ivory tusk.
meanings.sent3: The sailor scrimshaws a funny face on the whalebone, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: She scrimshaws her memories on the ivory, preserving them forever.
meanings.sent5: The craftsman scrimshaws a majestic whale on the ivory, capturing its beauty.

meanings.definition: Scrimshaws (noun): objects made by scrimshawing, typically decorative items made from whalebone or ivory
meanings.sent1: The museum displays exquisite scrimshaws from the 19th century.
meanings.sent2: Collectors value authentic scrimshaws for their historical significance.
meanings.sent3: The antique shop owner proudly showcases a collection of scrimshaws.
meanings.sent4: The scrimshaws on the shelf gleam under the museum lights.
meanings.sent5: Visitors admire the intricate details of the scrimshaws on display.
